summary: Anne Paul Wilander was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily consist of payroll records and certifications detailing her employment, position, and salary within the committee. These records span from June 1977 to March 1979, indicating her period of employment with the HSCA. The documents do not specify her exact role within the HSCA, but they confirm her status as a paid staff member. A Final Determination Notification mentions the redaction of her Social Security number from payroll records.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Anne Paul Wilander's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her contribution to the committee's operations during its investigation.
